property.name: mapred.job.tracker
property.description: JobTracker address ip:port or use uri maprfs:/// for default cluster or maprfs:///mapr/san_jose_cluster1 to connect 'san_jose_cluster1' cluster.

property.name: mapred.local.dir
property.description: The local directory where MapReduce stores job jar, xml files and creates work dirs for tasks. MapR hadoop uses a local volume map outputs.

property.name: webinterface.private.actions
property.description: If set to true, jobs can be killed from JT's web interface. Enable this option if the interfaces are only reachable by those who have the right authorization.

property.name: mapred.jobtracker.port
property.description: Port on which JobTracker listens. Read by JobTracker to start RPC Server.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.outofband.heartbeat
property.description: Expert: Set this to true to let the tasktracker send an out-of-band heartbeat on task-completion for better latency.

property.name: mapred.system.dir
property.description: The shared directory where MapReduce stores control files.

property.name: mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.dir
property.description: The directory where the job status information is persisted in a file system to be available after it drops of the memory queue and between jobtracker restarts.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.staging.root.dir
property.description: The root of the staging area for users' job files In practice, this should be the directory where users' home directories are located (usually /user)

property.name: mapreduce.job.split.metainfo.maxsize
property.description: The maximum permissible size of the split metainfo file. The JobTracker won't attempt to read split metainfo files bigger than the configured value. No limits if set to -1.

property.name: mapred.jobtracker.retiredjobs.cache.size
property.description: The number of retired job status to keep in the cache.

property.name: mapred.job.tracker.history.completed.location
property.description: The completed job history files are stored at this single well known location. If nothing is specified, the files are stored at ${hadoop.job.history.location}/done in local filesystem.

property.name: hadoop.job.history.location
property.description: If job tracker is static the history files are stored in this single well known place on local filesystem. If No value is set here, by default, it is in the local file system at ${hadoop.log.dir}/history. History files are moved to mapred.jobtracker.history.completed.location which is on MapRFs JobTracker volume.

property.name: mapred.jobtracker.jobhistory.lru.cache.size
property.description: The number of job history files loaded in memory. The jobs are loaded when they are first accessed. The cache is cleared based on LRU.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.recovery.dir
property.description: Recovery Directory. Stores list of known TaskTrackers.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.recovery.maxtime
property.description: Maximum time in seconds JobTracker should stay in recovery mode. JobTracker recovers job after talking to all running tasktrackers. On large cluster if many jobs are to be recovered, mapreduce.jobtracker.recovery.maxtime should be increased.

property.name: mapred.jobtracker.restart.recover
property.description: "true" to enable (job) recovery upon restart, "false" to start afresh

property.name: mapred.fairscheduler.eventlog.enabled
property.description: Enable scheduler logging in ${HADOOP_LOG_DIR}/fairscheduler/

property.name: mapred.fairscheduler.smalljob.schedule.enable
property.description: Enable small job fast scheduling inside fair scheduler. TaskTrackers should reserve a slot called ephemeral slot which is used for smalljob if cluster is busy.

property.name: mapred.fairscheduler.smalljob.max.maps
property.description: Small job definition. Max number of maps allowed in small job.

property.name: mapred.fairscheduler.smalljob.max.reducers
property.description: Small job definition. Max number of reducers allowed in small job.

property.name: mapred.fairscheduler.smalljob.max.inputsize
property.description: Small job definition. Max input size in bytes allowed for a small job. Default is 10GB.

property.name: mapred.fairscheduler.smalljob.max.reducer.inputsize
property.description: Small job definition. Max estimated input size for a reducer allowed in small job. Default is 1GB per reducer.

property.name: mapred.cluster.ephemeral.tasks.memory.limit.mb
property.description: Small job definition. Max memory in mbytes reserved for an ephermal slot. Default is 200mb. This value must be same on JobTracker and TaskTracker nodes.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.map.tasks.maximum
property.description: The maximum number of map tasks that will be run simultaneously by a task tracker.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.prefetch.maptasks
property.description: How many map tasks should be scheduled in-advance on a tasktracker. To be given in % of map slots. Default is 1.0 which means number of tasks overscheduled = total map slots on tasktracker.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.reduce.tasks.maximum
property.description: The maximum number of reduce tasks that will be run simultaneously by a task tracker.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.ephemeral.tasks.maximum
property.description: Reserved slot for small job scheduling

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.ephemeral.tasks.timeout
property.description: Maximum time in ms a task is allowed to occupy ephemeral slot

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.ephemeral.tasks.ulimit
property.description: Ulimit (bytes) on all tasks scheduled on an ephemeral slot

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb
property.description: Maximum phyiscal memory tasktracker should reserve for mapreduce tasks. If tasks use more than the limit, task using maximum memory will be killed. Expert only: Set this value iff tasktracker should use a certain amount of memory for mapreduce tasks. In MapR Distro warden figures this number based on services configured on a node. Setting mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb to -1 will disable physical memory accounting and task management.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.heapbased.memory.management
property.description: Expert only: If admin wants to prevent swapping by not launching too many tasks use this option. Task's memory usage is based on max java heap size (-Xmx). By default -Xmx will be computed by tasktracker based on slots and memory reserved for mapreduce tasks. See mapred.map.child.java.opts/mapred.reduce.child.java.opts.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.taskmemorymanager.killtask.maxRSS
property.description: When all mapreduce tasks exceed max allowed limit on TaskTracker (mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb) kill tasks which are using maximum memory. By default recently launched tasks will be chosen.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb.low
property.description: When TaskTracker kills tasks to bring total memory usage down, mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb.low decides how much TaskTracker will bring it down to. By default mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb.low = (80% of mapreduce.tasktracker.reserved.physicalmemory.mb)

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.jvm.idle.time
property.description: If jvm is idle for more than mapreduce.tasktracker.jvm.idle.time (milliseconds) tasktracker will kill it.

property.name: mapred.task.tracker.task-controller
property.description: TaskController which is used to launch and manage task execution

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.task-controller.config.overwrite
property.description: LinuxTaskController needs a config file set at HADOOP_HOME/conf/taskcontroller.cfg It has following parameters - mapred.local.dir = Local dir used by tasktracker, taken from mapred-site.xml. hadoop.log.dir = hadoop log dir, taken from system properties of the tasktracker process mapreduce.tasktracker.group = groups allowed to run tasktracker see 'mapreduce.tasktracker.group' min.user.id = Don't allow any user below this uid to launch a task. banned.users = users who are not allowed to launch any tasks. If set to true, TaskTracker will always overwrite config file with default values as min.user.id = -1(check disabled), banned.users = bin, mapreduce.tasktracker.group = root Set to false while using customized config and restart TaskTracker.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.group
property.description: Expert: Group to which TaskTracker belongs. If LinuxTaskController is configured via mapreduce.tasktracker.taskcontroller, the group owner of the task-controller binary '$HADOOP_HOME/bin/platform/bin/task-controller' should be same as this group.

property.name: mapreduce.cluster.map.userlog.retain-size
property.description: Bytes to retain from each map-task log. Disabled by default.

property.name: mapreduce.cluster.reduce.userlog.retain-size
property.description: Bytes to retain from each reduce-task log. Disabled by default.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.task.slowlaunch
property.description: Wait after each task launch. It gives more control to TaskTracker in tracking memory used by all tasks. Should be set on nodes running critical services like CLDB, JobTracker, ZooKeeper.

property.name: keep.failed.task.files
property.description: Should the files for failed tasks be kept. This should only be used on jobs that are failing, because the storage is never reclaimed. It also prevents the map outputs from being erased from the reduce directory as they are consumed.

property.name: mapred.job.reuse.jvm.num.tasks
property.description: How many tasks to run per jvm. If set to -1, there is no limit.

property.name: mapred.map.tasks.speculative.execution
property.description: If true, then multiple instances of some map tasks may be executed in parallel.

property.name: mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution
property.description: If true, then multiple instances of some reduce tasks may be executed in parallel.

property.name: mapred.job.map.memory.physical.mb
property.description: Maximum physical memory limit for map task of this job. If limit is exceeded task attempt will be FAILED.

property.name: mapred.job.reduce.memory.physical.mb
property.description: Maximum physical memory limit for reduce task of this job. If limit is exceeded task attempt will be FAILED..

property.name: mapreduce.task.classpath.user.precedence
property.description: Set to true if user wants to set different classpath.

property.name: mapred.map.child.java.opts
property.description:
Java opts for the map tasks. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of: -Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc
The configuration variable mapred.{map/reduce}.child.ulimit can be used to control the maximum virtual memory of the child processes.
MapR: Default heapsize(-Xmx) is determined by memory reserved for mapreduce at tasktracker. Reduce task is given more memory than a map task. Default memory for a map task = (Total Memory reserved for mapreduce) * (#mapslots/ (#mapslots + 1.3*#reduceslots))

property.name: mapred.reduce.child.java.opts
property.description:
Java opts for the reduce tasks.
MapR: Default heapsize(-Xmx) is determined by memory reserved for mapreduce at tasktracker. Reduce task is given more memory than map task. Default memory for a reduce task = (Total Memory reserved for mapreduce) * (1.3*#reduceslots / (#mapslots + 1.3*#reduceslots))

property.name: mapred.map.child.env
property.description: User added environment variables for the task tracker child processes. Example : 1) A=foo This will set the env variable A to foo 2) B=$B:c This is inherit tasktracker's B env variable.

property.name: mapred.map.child.ulimit
property.description:
The maximum virtual memory, in KB, of a process launched by the Map-Reduce framework. This can be used to control both the Mapper/Reducer tasks and applications using Hadoop Pipes, Hadoop Streaming etc. By default it is left unspecified to let cluster admins control it via limits.conf and other such relevant mechanisms.
Note: mapred.{map/reduce}.child.ulimit must be greater than or equal to the -Xmx passed to JavaVM, else the VM might not start.

property.name: io.sort.mb
property.description: Buffer used to hold map outputs in memory before writing final map outputs. Setting this value very low may cause spills. If a average input to map is "MapIn" bytes then typically value of io.sort.mb should be '1.25 times MapIn' bytes.

property.name: io.sort.factor
property.description: The number of streams to merge at once while sorting files. This determines the number of open file handles.

property.name: io.sort.record.percent
property.description: The percentage of io.sort.mb dedicated to tracking record boundaries. Let this value be r, io.sort.mb be x. The maximum number of records collected before the collection thread must block is equal to (r * x) / 4

property.name: mapred.reduce.slowstart.completed.maps
property.description: Fraction of the number of maps in the job which should be complete before reduces are scheduled for the job.

property.name: mapreduce.reduce.input.limit
property.description: The limit on the input size of the reduce. If the estimated input size of the reduce is greater than this value, job is failed. A value of -1 means that there is no limit set.

property.name: mapred.reduce.parallel.copies
property.description: The default number of parallel transfers run by reduce during the copy(shuffle) phase.
